description: Borrowed from Spanish guano, from Quechua wanu.

nouns.description: guano (countable and uncountable, plural guanos or guanoes)

entries.meaning: Dung from a sea bird or from a bat.
Coccothrinax borhidiana, a variety of palm tree indigenous to Cuba.
examples: A roof made of guano palm fronds will last up to 15 years, although Maya harvesters point out that the leaves must be cut when the moon is full; otherwise, the stems become susceptible to insect damage.
